result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan D Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing on 12-15-15 at 8:30am, Br-30
*07-14-2018/Restitution Order - Set at $8000 payable to Radio Shack.

Pay DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements. Court ordered monies taken by the DOC's from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance would to be paid while on ES. If not paid by end of extended supervision, balance would convert to a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No controlled substances or alcohol; Absolute sobriety.
- AODA assessment; treatment, if needed.
- No Contact with the victim, Radio Shack, or co-actors. Trevante Young and Trevor Young.
- The defendant has to receive his Bachelor's Degree.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant of the determinate sentence pursuant to statue and in accordance with Form CR-234

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Bryan Sanders not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin did not appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Griffin was in another court.

Matter here for a Restitution hearing.  Attorney Bowe indicated that her client will be signing a Stipulation as to the restitution and will forward that to ADA Griffin.
RECEIVED AND FILED.
ORDER TO PRODUCE

Defendant Bryan Sanders in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Bryan Sanders in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  The state needs additional time and requests case be adjourned. Defense counsel does not object.   The Court granted state's adjournment but informed parties this would be the last adjournment.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bryan Sanders in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Bryan Sanders in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Defendant is remanded pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order to Produce for Final Pre-Trial on August 12, 2015 @ 8:30 am received and filed
from defendant filed.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for final pretrial on 8-12-15, 8:30 and  Jury trial scheduled for 08-17-2015 at 09:00 am.
Order To Produce Transport

Received and filed with court.

Defendant Bryan Sanders in court with attorney Olya Petukhova for Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Bryan Sanders in custody.  Ron Dague for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Robert St.Onge-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kristal S. or Radio Shack located at 1844. S. 15th St. Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
